fields.description:
The eucalyptus-cloud service hung when attemping to shut down with the following error in the cloud log:

{noformat}

comments.body: Likely a duplicate of either EUCA-6195 or EUCA-6547 (or both if they are the same issue)
This is on a non-HA system with a single frontend and node. Not sure if that changes anything.
[~kedwards], please assign as appropriate
I just got the exception reproduced but in my case, this didn't cause shutdown to hang... Must have been something else that caused the hanging of shutdown.

[~sjones],

Can you review my changes. I believe there may be a cleaner solution but not too sure what... Thanks.

Hanging when shutting down during database synchronization does not seem to me like something we would need for fix in 3.4.1 (corner case, easily worked around)

If this issue also occurs for non-HA configurations then there are presumably other ways to reproduce it.

Added one more change suggested by [~kedwards]. Moved the proxool shutdown into a try/catch block. I'm running another QA sequence to make sure its not introducing any more issues. Here's the hash for the latest code change for review as well.

git show --color 07d03f9fa92f6887d6e635c53f8e5b32ed5c41d0 setup_db.groovy

[~sjones], can you double check my changes and make sure its not going to screw up anything. If this is ok, then lets move forward for 3.4.1.
[~chuck], I would not make this change unless we are very clear that it fixes the issue (and understand why)

I understand but after 2 days of trying to reproduce this case, I couldn't reproduce anything else than the case with the partition timeout. So what would you suggest should be the next step with this case?
We should find a way to reproduce the issue.
That's the procedure I was using. Will try using run-instance instead.

Ok, with a bit of luck, I've been able to reproduce this consistently and find the steps to reproduce which could coincide with a customer going through an upgrade:

1) Have only one running CLC
2) Start the standby CLC and look at the running CLC logs for DB syinc messages
{noformat}
2013-11-26 14:01:34 DEBUG 000001349 Databases                | ActiveHostSet: volatile       [10.111.1.112, 10.111.1.102]!=[10.111.1.102]
2013-11-26 14:01:35 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | Transaction blocked on sync: com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$DatabaseProvider.list(ServiceConfigurations.java:113)
2013-11-26 14:01:35 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | ActiveHostSet: volatile       [10.111.1.112, 10.111.1.102]!=[10.111.1.102]
2013-11-26 14:01:36 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | Transaction blocked on sync: com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$DatabaseProvider.list(ServiceConfigurations.java:113)
2013-11-26 14:01:37 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | Transaction blocked on sync: com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$DatabaseProvider.list(ServiceConfigurations.java:113)
2013-11-26 14:01:37 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | ActiveHostSet: volatile       [10.111.1.112, 10.111.1.102]!=[10.111.1.102]
2013-11-26 14:01:38 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | Transaction blocked on sync: com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$DatabaseProvider.list(ServiceConfigurations.java:113)
2013-11-26 14:01:39 DEBUG 000000100 Databases                | Transaction blocked on sync: com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$DatabaseProvider.list(ServiceConfigurations.java:113)
{noformat}
3) When the message start spuing in the logs, stop the active CLC and notice that it will never terminate...
Ok... Here's a twist... every time this happens, if I wait long enough, the threads will eventually terminate...
Scratch that. This was reproducing a similar case as the one I previously described.
hmm! more confusing, I looked at the logs and there's nothing related to proxool in there and it sounds like Matt is having the same issue I encountered (same signature)...

[~sjones], [~kedwards],

After digging into it and revisiting the logs in this case, I'm duplicating the original case where many threads are entering the Databases.awaitSynchronized() and will be waiting on isVolatile() to return false up to 120 seconds each to timeout prior the system being able to complete the shutdown sequence. I cannot duplicate any other cases.
And that's essentially because isSynchronized() keeps returning false which will remain false in this case....
[~chuck], this issue was reported against a non-HA setup so a database synchronization fix does not seem like the appropriate way to address it.

[~sjones], I was informed that this is occurring more frequently on an HA setup compared to a non-HA setup which is why I'm using HA to increase chances of reproduction. In the last 2+ weeks, I have never been able to reproduce the proxool case with and without HA setup. But I can consistently reproduce a case that customers can encounter and get a bad user experience from it. The non-intrusive and likely solution for this specific case is to increase the shutdown timeout in the init.d script so the customer don't end up doing a kill -9 on processes that will normally shutdown if they waited 2-3 more minutes.

As far as the proxool issue, I cannot duplicate and don't have a solution for this one...
[~chuck], just want to ensure we are clear that the reported issue is not being fixed. IMO increasing the shutdown timeout is not a good solution.

[~chuck], I would abort the database synchronization when the user stops the eucalyptus-cloud service (throw an exception from awaitSynchronized when shutting down if volatile). If you use this issue for the fix then please reopen EUCA-6195 so we have something tracking the non-HA issue.

[~kedwards] , [~chuck]  Which issue is it we want to fix here the HA or the Non-HA issue? As far as I can tell the non-ha issue is not reliably reproduced where the HA issue is reproducible and they appear to be separate issues. I believe the non-ha issue has more customer relevance as most are not using HA.

I just hit this on 4.0 non-ha.

{code}
[root@d-31 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud restart
Stopping Eucalyptus services: CRITICAL: timed out waiting for eucalyptus-cloud process to shut down (pid=22396, ppid=22179).
CRITICAL: this is most likely a bug; to kill processes (THIS MAY CAUSE DATA LOSS) run: kill -9 22396 22179
done.
Starting Eucalyptus services:
Eucalyptus services are already running!
{code}

What I had done was change the port for registered Eucalyptus components in verifying EUCA-8428. I first changed the CC to a new port number, the CC was then not ready, I restarted CC still not ready so I changed back to original port that was configured. CC still not ready so I restarted the cloud. Link to SOS report: https://app.box.com/s/t3ictwtpjpf7fcil5lvy

I was able to reproduce this by using this S3 client:
https://github.com/viglesiasce/s3tup

With the following config:
{code}
---
- bucket: dropbox-backup
  hostname: walrus.home:8773
  canned_acl: public-read
  rsync:
    - src: /Users/viglesias/Dropbox
      delete: true
      patterns: ['*']
{code}

And the following command:
{code}s3tup config.yml -v -c 200{code}

It appears that at high concurrency (200 threads) the Walrus craps out and doesn't stop properly.

Thread dump from shutdown hang. Notice the Prototyper and HouseKeeper threads waiting on the same reader lock.

{code}

"Thread-1" prio=10 tid=0x0000000005745800 nid=0x22aa in Object.wait() [0x00007ffdb09e4000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	- waiting on <0x00000000c8af9eb0> (a org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$WriterLock)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:503)

	- locked <0x00000000c8af9eb0> (a org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$WriterLock)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ConnectionPool.acquirePrimaryWriteLock(ConnectionPool.java:1003)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ConnectionPool.shutdown(ConnectionPool.java:470)

	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxoolFacade.shutdown(ProxoolFacade.java:230)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxoolFacade.shutdown(ProxoolFacade.java:209)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxoolFacade$shutdown.call(Unknown Source)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCall(CallSiteArray.java:45)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:108)
	at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.call(AbstractCallSite.java:112)
	at PostgresqlBootstrapper$3.run(setup_db.groovy:501)
	at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.OrderedShutdown$1.run(OrderedShutdown.java:134)
	
"Prototyper" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007ffe44001800 nid=0x1786 in Object.wait() [0x00007ffdee2db000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	- waiting on <0x00000000c8af9e98> (a org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$ReaderLock)

"HouseKeeper" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0000000003a6f000 nid=0x1784 in Object.wait() [0x00007ffdee3dc000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	- waiting on <0x00000000c8af9e98> (a org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$ReaderLock)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:503)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$ReaderLock.acquire(WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock.java:173)
	- locked <0x00000000c8af9e98> (a org.logicalcobwebs.concurrent.WriterPreferenceReadWriteLock$ReaderLock)

Code Review Request : EUCA-7430 eucalyptus-cloud service hangs on shutdown	

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-7430

diff :  git show --color 88ca0c790cc8316b8fe5f9eb8c9867f01092598b

Summary: Cloud-service non-deterministicly times out on shutdown with the error:
         CRITICAL: timed out waiting for eucalyptus-cloud process to shut down (pid=22396, ppid=22179).
         CRITICAL: this is most likely a bug; to kill processes (THIS MAY CAUSE DATA LOSS) run: kill -9 22396 22179

Solution: The problem was the legacy call to ProxoolFacade.disableShutdownHook() at line 158: of setup_dbpool.groovy.
          This was causing the thread contention we see in the thread dump. We were disabling the shutdownhook
          in setup_dbpool.groovy and then registering the shutdownhook in setup_db.groovy.
          The hang was occurring when the OrderedShutdown was called with the disabled shutdownhook. 
          I removed the call to ProxoolFacade.disableShutdownHook()  
          
Unit test : I am able to reproduce this consistently by running the two scripts attached to this bug,
            startStopLoop which just starts and stops the cloud sever in a loop and describeloop which calls describe instances
             in a loop
             To reproduce:
             1) on clc run startStopLoop
             2) on clc run describeloop
             3) startStop will print out the count of start/stop iterations if it fails you will see the timed out error 
                described in the summary. In my tests with out the all the failures were in the first 25 iterations. With the fix 
                I have run over 700 iterations without a failure.
I am testing that right now.

[~kedwards] With the changes suggested by Chris, moving  the proxool shutdown method call before the postgresql operation and adding back the call to  ProxoolFacade.disableShutdownHook() I ran 400 iterations of my test with no error. I will check in this fix.
[~mdshaonimran] What is the status of this issue? Are you still seeing this in 3.4.2?

Hey [~mmunn1], I was able to reproduce this on the 43rd iteration in older version (3.4.1). Ran about 100 iteration in 3.4.2, could not reproduce it.
Fixed.

Installed Packages:
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.2
Release     : 0.0.542.20140204git5262e14e.el6
Size        : 2.4 M
Repo        : installed
{noformat}
